title: Emilia Clarke puts on a chic display in a white midi-dress with gold print to promote Last Christmas
text:
She recently revealed suffering two brain aneurysms helped her resonate with her character in Last Christmas.

And Emila Clarke put on a stylish display as she headed to Good Morning America to promote the film in New York City on Wednesday.

The Game Of Thrones star, 33, looked sensational in an elegant white midi dress, which had a chic gold floral print across the front.

Glamorous: Emilia Clarke put on a chic display in a white midi-dress with a gold print as she arrived in style at Good Morning America to promote Last Christmas on Wednesday

Emilia cinched her outfit at the waist with a thin black belt, and added a pop of colour to the look by keeping her personal items in a bright red handbag.

The actress shrugged a beige coat over her shoulders to keep off the winter chill, while she complemented her look by stepping out in white heels.

Her brunette locks were brushed into glamorous waves, while Emilia wore a slick of pink lipstick and dark eyeliner to highlight her pretty features.

Stylish: Emilia cinched her outfit at the waist with a thin black belt, and added a pop of colour to the look by keeping her personal items in a bright red handbag

Cosy: The actress shrugged a beige coat over her shoulders to keep off the winter chill, while she complemented her look by stepping out in white heels

Friendly: Emilia waved at fans in delight as she walked through the rain

Speaking to Stella magazine earlier this year, the brunette said she resonated with her character Kate in the film, who is a woman also recovering from a life-threatening illness.

'It was uncanny reading the script because it’s my life at this point,' she said.

'I have the benefit of having space between myself and my sickness and what you see through Kate is the fear of what happens when your body fails you in some way.'

Stunning: Emilia's brunette locks were brushed into glamorous waves, while she wore a slick of pink lipstick and dark eyeliner to highlight her pretty features

Personal: Emilia recently revealed suffering two brain aneurysms helped her resonate with her character in the romantic comedy

In the film, written by Emma Thompson, Emilia's character Kate finds work as Santa's elf for a department store and unexpectedly finds love with Tom, played by Henry Golding.

It comes after the star discussed her recovery from the life-threatening aneurysm she first suffered in 2011, when she was just 24 years old.

Appearing on CBS Sunday Morning in April where she recalled the dark place she went to after her surgery, she shared images from her hospital stay, revealing the second aneurysm very nearly killed her.

Love is in the air: In the film, Emilia's character Kate finds work as Santa's elf for a department store and unexpectedly finds love with Tom, played by Henry Golding

Candid: Emilia admitted she resonated with her character Kate in the film, who is a woman also recovering from a life-threatening illness, and felt it was 'uncanny reading the script'

Discussing the impact it had not just on her physical health but mental wellbeing, she revealed: 'The first time it was difficult, with the second one I found it much harder to stay optimistic.

'[I coped with it as a] a day to day thing. I definitely went through a period of being... down - putting it mildly.'

Emilia explained that when a part of your brain is starved of blood for more than a minute it dies, which is what happened to her after her second aneurysm.

Last Christmas hits cinemas November 7 in the UK, and November 8 in the USA.
